Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which the rich will not benefit from the tax cut proposal.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it contradicts the tax proposal outlined by the Trump administration in April, which heavily benefits high-income taxpayers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the tax plan will not benefit the rich without providing evidence or details to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as the nonpartisan Tax Policy Center estimated that the top 1 percent would receive a significant tax cut under a "Trump-like plan."
